meanings.definition: Along the shore; parallel to the coast.
meanings.sent1: The boat sailed alongshore, following the coastline closely.
meanings.sent2: She walked alongshore, collecting seashells as she went.
meanings.sent3: The crab scuttled alongshore, waving its claws in the air.
meanings.sent4: The seagull glided alongshore, its wings outstretched like a dancer.
meanings.sent5: The waves crashed alongshore, creating a soothing rhythm.

meanings.definition: Moving or situated along the shore.
meanings.sent1: The alongshore path offered stunning views of the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The beach was lined with alongshore cottages painted in bright colors.
meanings.sent3: The children built an alongshore sandcastle, complete with seashell decorations.
meanings.sent4: The alongshore breeze carried the scent of salt and seaweed.
meanings.sent5: The alongshore rocks provided a natural barrier against the incoming tide.
